item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: webdev@csquaredsocial.com
item.content:encoded:
-The Piped
Peony

The Piped Peony Academy is for everyone! 
We’ll learn, grow, and bloom together with helpful 
piping tutorials that take your skills to new heights.

Sign up for 7 free days
Watch Anytime,
Anywhere
Watch on-demand classes at your convenience, allowing for a more flexible and efficient learning experience.
Online Community
& Support
Upon joining, you will be granted access to a private Facebook group that provides you with the necessary support to acquire and enhance your piping skills.
Exclusive
Recipes
As a member, you will gain access to cake and piping recipes that will enhance the beauty and taste of your creations, including our exclusive Blooming Buttercream™ recipe.
New Monthly
Content
Stay ahead of the latest trends and seasons with new designs and the latest innovative techniques.

Nice to meet you!

My name is Dara

I fell in love with buttercream flowers four years ago, inspired by my passion for food. Food is a love language that bonds family, friends and communities-there's a reason everyone gathers in the kitchen! I wanted to find a way to share food's beauty, and buttercream flowers were it!

Learning to pipe buttercream flowers wasn't easy. First, I had to learn all about piping tips on my own, which felt like learning a whole new language. Then, I spent hours watching unhelpful videos that produced flowers that were flat and unrealistic looking.  The hardest part? There was no one to turn to for guidance if I couldn't get a technique. I was all alone on my journey. 

That’s why I started the Piped Peony Academy. I wanted to build a path for anyone who had a desire and will to learn the craft. Most importantly, I wanted to price it to be affordable, and I wanted to be there to offer guidance and support.

Priced affordably so anyone can join, and with my personal support, and dozens of videos and new content every other week, The Piped Peony Academy is for everyone - beginners to advanced bakers

You won't be learning alone. Start your journey with me today!  

Learn More

A Community of
Thousands of Bakers

Our Latest Videos

Check out our most recent videos for our academy members!

Acrylics: The Secret Agents of Sharp Edges & Smooth Finishes Class
The Black Cake Class
The Decorative Mum Class
Learn More

FAQs

Frequently
Asked
Questions

EMPTY ONE Once you join, do you have to pay extra for each video?

No, all videos past present and future are included for just $15/ month

Are the classes recorded?

Yes, at this point they are all pre-recorded so that you can learn on a schedule that works for you.

Can I see all the videos or just the new ones after I join?

Once you sign up, you have access to the full library of classes.

Do you do live classes?

Not at this point, but it is something I am looking to do in the future!

What if I don’t want to sign up monthly?

The membership recurs monthly, but there is no obligation and you can cancel anytime. Of course, we hope you love what you see and decide to stick with us on this journey!

Join The Piped Peony
Academy Community!

Sign up today

item.title: Meet Dara
item.dc:creator: webdev@csquaredsocial.com
item.content:encoded:
ABOUT

The Piped Peony Academy is for everyone!
We’ll learn, grow, and bloom together.

OUR
-GOAL

Grow your flower piping skills and bloom as a baker with The Piped Peony Academy! With new biweekly content and 24/7 access to the video library, The Piped Peony Academy is your home for everything flower piping. As a self-taught expert, I have videos for beginners and piping pros alike. From roses to sunflowers, you’ll have everything you need in one place. Let’s start decorating!

Dara

As a mom, wife, foodie, and artist, I turned my passion for flower piping into something more. 

After watching endless unhelpful YouTube videos, I knew The Piped Peony Academy had the potential to help cottage bakers of all skill levels refine their techniques petal-by-petal. Additionally, members can connect with other decorators through our online community to share your creations and learn from others.

One of my most exciting accomplishments is my signature Blooming Buttercream™. With the texture of Korean buttercream with the flavor of American buttercream, it’s perfect for creating every detail. 

Let’s start decorating together  – I’ll be with you every step of the way!

item.title: Academy Details
item.dc:creator: webdev@csquaredsocial.com
item.content:encoded:
ACADEMY

Get started with a 7-day free trial!

No contract membership for only $15 a month.

Sign up for 7 free days

By signing up you agree to The Piped Peony’s Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.

Why Piped Peony

The Piped Peony Academy has everything you need, all in one place, to learn the ins and outs of flower piping techniques. Your membership includes:

  • Unlimited classes
  • Techniques
  • Exclusive recipes
  • Color mixing ideas
  • Support & community
  • No contract required

Featured Video

https://thepipedpeony.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/TPPPromo2023v4.mp4

What You Get

Watch Anytime,
Anywhere
Watch on-demand classes at your convenience, allowing for a more flexible and efficient learning experience.
Online Community
& Support
Upon joining, you will be granted access to a private Facebook group that provides you with the necessary support to acquire and enhance your piping skills.
Exclusive
Recipes
As a member, you will gain access to cake and piping recipes that will enhance the beauty and taste of your creations, including our exclusive Blooming Buttercream™ recipe.
New Monthly
Content
Stay ahead of the latest trends and seasons with new designs and the latest innovative techniques.

Recipes

Blooming
Buttercream™

Our exclusive Blooming Buttercream™ recipe is a fusion of Korean buttercream texture and American flavor. Equal parts delicious and perfect for piping, Blooming Buttercream™ is one-of-a-kind.  

Become a member of The Piped Peony Academy and get access to this recipe and many others.

Sign up today

Video Series

Piping beautiful blooms starts here! Learn how to
pipe stunning flowers that look too good to eat.
  • The Rose Series
  • The Peony Series
  • The Ranunculus Series
  • The Sunflower Series
  • The Mum Series
  • The Buttercream Basics Series

And many more!

The Go-To Community
of Thousands of Bakers

Frequently
Asked
Questions

EMPTY ONE Once you join, do you have to pay extra for each video?

No, all videos past present and future are included for just $15/ month

Are the classes recorded?

Yes, at this point they are all pre-recorded so that you can learn on a schedule that works for you.

Can I see all the videos or just the new ones after I join?

Once you sign up, you have access to the full library of classes.

Do you do live classes?

Not at this point, but it is something I am looking to do in the future!

What if I don’t want to sign up monthly?

The membership recurs monthly, but there is no obligation and you can cancel anytime. Of course, we hope you love what you see and decide to stick with us on this journey!

I never received an email reply!

Many email clients like Gmail, Yahoo and Hotmail routinely block any email suspected of spam content. Unfortunately legitimate emails get blocked as well. Try going into your email settings and whitelisting thepipedpeony.com and hopefully that will resolve the issue.

item.title: Supply List
item.dc:creator: webdev@csquaredsocial.com
item.content:encoded:
Dara's Faves

SUPPLY LIST

Dara has compiled a collection of her favorite tools and equipment, designed to
help individuals get started.

Supply List

Dara has put together an all-inclusive list of supplies, tools, and piping tip styles that
are specifically customized to your project. You can trust her recommendations to
guide you through the creative process and help you bring your vision to life. Flowers and basic piping Color Cake and cupcake decorating Kids

Flowers and Basic Piping

Tips
  • Wilton: 4B, 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 16, 59s, 61, 81, 101, 102, 103, 104, 123, 133, 199, 349, 352, 366 
  • Ateco: 00, 41, 79, 80, 81, 124K, 126K, 227, 349, 869, 159 (only if lefthanded)

  • G.G. Cakraft: 55, 810, 105, 106, 1051 (lefthanded tip) or 1052 (righthanded tip, 1061 (lefthanded tip) or 1062 (right-handed tip)

Equipment
  • Piping block
  • Extra large flower nail
  • Flower lifter (oval tip)
  • Flower lifter (scissor tip)
  • Microwavable bowls
  • Storage containers
  • G.G. Cakraft Y flower nail
  • Silicone spatulas
  • Piping bags (10-12 in)
  • Needle nose pliers
  • Food scale
  • Piping couplers
  • Floral wire (22 gauge)
  • Styrofoam

Coloring

Gel Colors (Water-based, used only for Blooming Buttercream)
  • Americolor: super black, red, yellow, blue, optional: mauve, soft pink, electric pink
  • Chefmaster: buckeye, brown, liquid whitener
  • Flower lifter (oval tip)
  • Flower lifter (scissor tip)
Oil-Based Colors (Used only for Italian Meringue Buttercream)
  • Colour Mill (all are completely optional; you can color Italian Meringue with gel colors; it’s just takes longer to develop the color; Sugar Sister’s pricing for these is better than Amazon’s): black, brown, red, yellow, blue, green
  • Food scale

Cake and Cupcake

Tips
  • Pastry brush
  • Piping tips: Ateco 869
  • Bamboo skewers
  • Cake turntable
  • Cake leveler
  • Cake drum (2” larger than cake layer)
  • Piping bags, preferable 12”-16”
  • 10” metal bench scraper
  • Piping tips: Wilton 789 (optional)
  • 2 candy thermometers
  • 1 acrylic disc (.5” bigger than cake, ex: 6” Cake, get 6.5” acrylic disc)
  • Food scale
  • Chocolate or white chocolate melting wafers
  • Parchment paper
  • Cake boards; same size as cake or larger (I usually buy a bulk pack of 9” boards so I can use them for all sizes of cakes.)
  • White fondant
  • Round tip paint brush or equivalent

Kids

Tips
  • Wilton: 2A or 4B, 1, 2, 5, 6, 10, 12, 16, 59s/59, 81, 101, 103, 123, 233, 349, 366 *check out the Wilton 55 piece set if you need all of these.
  • Ateco: 00, 79, 124K, 126K, 227, 349, 869

  • G.G. Cakraft: 102 (opt), 1061 (left-handed tip) or 1062 (right-handed tip), 106

 

Equipment
  • Piping block
  • Extra large flower nail
  • Flower lifter (oval tip)
  • Flower lifter (scissor tip)
  • Microwavable bowls
  • Storage containers
  • G.G. Cakraft Y flower nail
  • Silicone spatulas
  • Piping bags (10-12 in)
  • Needle nose pliers
  • Food scale
  • Piping couplers
  • Floral wire (22 gauge)
  • Styrofoam

item.title: Tip Guide
item.dc:creator: webdev@csquaredsocial.com
item.content:encoded:
Top 10

TIP GUIDE

The correct piping tip is essential when crafting floral piping designs, as it enables you to achieve various shapes and sizes, bringing your creative decorations to life. 
10

Snip tip

Uses: Sunflowers, Peonies and Daisies This tip is great for adding realistic stamens and center accents to your flowers! BUY NOW 
9

Atecco 227

Uses: Dahlias and Chrysanthemums If this tip were a person, it would be consistent, strong, and full of surprises! This is a great tip for achieving long thin petals that can hold their own! BUY NOW 
8

GG Cakraft 106

Uses: Leaves, Eucalyptus, anemones There was never a better tip made for leafing! This tip is thick enough to create substantial single leaves, and thicker petals that can hold their own! I like the GG Cakraft 105 to add sizing variation! BUY NOW 
7

Atecco 00

Uses: Peonies, Love Lies Bleeding, Raspberries, succulents, anemones, billy balls Sometimes it’s in the detail! This tip is great for piping fine details on everything from envies to succulents, and everything in between! BUY NOW 
6

Wilton 4b or 2a

Uses: Making an appearance in literally every 3-dimensional flower you see! Guess where? It’s all about that base! BUY NOW 
5

Wilton 349

Uses: Leafing accents, smaller flowers like lily of the valley and lilacs, sunflowers, dahlias This tip is a work horse! It’s great for fine veining detail, but also exactly what you need for smaller center petals of a flower. BUY NOW 
4

Wilton 101

Uses: Lilacs, lily of the valley, artichokes, peonies, daisies, Gerber daisies, forget-me-nots, apple blossoms, hydrangea This tip is small but might! It’s perfect for adding small details, or piping small flowers to accent your buttercream flower cake or cupcake. BUY NOW 
3

Wilton 123

Uses: Peonies Once upon a time, Wilton 123 was born. He just knew he would grow up to pipe peonies, and one day he did! This tip is the most perfectly made tip for peony flowers in al stages of bloom, which you can learn to pipe at the Academy! BUY NOW 
2

GG Cakraft 1062 or 1061

Uses: Roses, English roses, David Austin roses, Juliette roses, peonies, anemones, leafing This tip is perfect for achieving those delicate larger curved petals on your two-dimensional, and three-dimensional flowers! BUY NOW 
1

Atecco 124k

Uses: Roses, English roses, David Austin roses, Juliette roses, ranunculus flowers, peonies, anemones, carnations, leafing If I were trapped on an island, I would want to have this tip and chapstick! This tip does it all! Purchase at least 10 and you’ll never feel lonely. BUY NOW

item.title: Meet Dara
item.dc:creator: webdev@csquaredsocial.com
item.content:encoded:
ABOUT

The Piped Peony Academy is for everyone!
We’ll learn, grow, and bloom together.

OUR
-GOAL

Grow your flower piping skills and bloom as a baker with The Piped Peony Academy! With new biweekly content and 24/7 access to the video library, The Piped Peony Academy is your home for everything flower piping. As a self-taught expert, I have videos for beginners and piping pros alike. From roses to sunflowers, you’ll have everything you need in one place. Let’s start decorating!

Dara

As a mom, wife, foodie, and artist, I turned my passion for flower piping into something more. 

After watching endless unhelpful YouTube videos, I knew The Piped Peony Academy had the potential to help cottage bakers of all skill levels refine their techniques petal-by-petal. Additionally, members can connect with other decorators through our online community to share your creations and learn from others.

One of my most exciting accomplishments is my signature Blooming Buttercream™. With the texture of Korean buttercream with the flavor of American buttercream, it’s perfect for creating every detail. 

Let’s start decorating together  – I’ll be with you every step of the way!

item.title: Supply List
item.dc:creator: webdev@csquaredsocial.com
item.content:encoded:
Dara's Faves

SUPPLY LIST

Dara has compiled a collection of her favorite tools and equipment, designed to
help individuals get started.

Supply List

Dara has put together an all-inclusive list of supplies, tools, and piping tip styles that
are specifically customized to your project. You can trust her recommendations to
guide you through the creative process and help you bring your vision to life. Flowers and basic piping Color Cake and cupcake decorating Kids

Flowers and Basic Piping

Tips
  • Wilton: 4B, 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 16, 59s, 61, 81, 101, 102, 103, 104, 123, 133, 199, 349, 352, 366 
  • Ateco: 00, 41, 79, 80, 81, 124K, 126K, 227, 349, 869, 159 (only if lefthanded)

  • G.G. Cakraft: 55, 810, 105, 106, 1051 (lefthanded tip) or 1052 (righthanded tip, 1061 (lefthanded tip) or 1062 (right-handed tip)

Equipment
  • Piping block
  • Extra large flower nail
  • Flower lifter (oval tip)
  • Flower lifter (scissor tip)
  • Microwavable bowls
  • Storage containers
  • G.G. Cakraft Y flower nail
  • Silicone spatulas
  • Piping bags (10-12 in)
  • Needle nose pliers
  • Food scale
  • Piping couplers
  • Floral wire (22 gauge)
  • Styrofoam

Coloring

Gel Colors (Water-based, used only for Blooming Buttercream)
  • Americolor: super black, red, yellow, blue, optional: mauve, soft pink, electric pink
  • Chefmaster: buckeye, brown, liquid whitener
  • Flower lifter (oval tip)
  • Flower lifter (scissor tip)
Oil-Based Colors (Used only for Italian Meringue Buttercream)
  • Colour Mill (all are completely optional; you can color Italian Meringue with gel colors; it’s just takes longer to develop the color; Sugar Sister’s pricing for these is better than Amazon’s): black, brown, red, yellow, blue, green
  • Food scale

Cake and Cupcake

Tips
  • Pastry brush
  • Piping tips: Ateco 869
  • Bamboo skewers
  • Cake turntable
  • Cake leveler
  • Cake drum (2” larger than cake layer)
  • Piping bags, preferable 12”-16”
  • 10” metal bench scraper
  • Piping tips: Wilton 789 (optional)
  • 2 candy thermometers
  • 1 acrylic disc (.5” bigger than cake, ex: 6” Cake, get 6.5” acrylic disc)
  • Food scale
  • Chocolate or white chocolate melting wafers
  • Parchment paper
  • Cake boards; same size as cake or larger (I usually buy a bulk pack of 9” boards so I can use them for all sizes of cakes.)
  • White fondant
  • Round tip paint brush or equivalent

Kids

Tips
  • Wilton: 2A or 4B, 1, 2, 5, 6, 10, 12, 16, 59s/59, 81, 101, 103, 123, 233, 349, 366 *check out the Wilton 55 piece set if you need all of these.
  • Ateco: 00, 79, 124K, 126K, 227, 349, 869

  • G.G. Cakraft: 102 (opt), 1061 (left-handed tip) or 1062 (right-handed tip), 106

 

Equipment
  • Piping block
  • Extra large flower nail
  • Flower lifter (oval tip)
  • Flower lifter (scissor tip)
  • Microwavable bowls
  • Storage containers
  • G.G. Cakraft Y flower nail
  • Silicone spatulas
  • Piping bags (10-12 in)
  • Needle nose pliers
  • Food scale
  • Piping couplers
  • Floral wire (22 gauge)
  • Styrofoam

item.title: Tip Guide
item.dc:creator: webdev@csquaredsocial.com
item.content:encoded:
Top 10

TIP GUIDE

The correct piping tip is essential when crafting floral piping designs, as it enables you to achieve various shapes and sizes, bringing your creative decorations to life. 
10

Snip tip

Uses: Sunflowers, Peonies and Daisies This tip is great for adding realistic stamens and center accents to your flowers! BUY NOW 
9

Atecco 227

Uses: Dahlias and Chrysanthemums If this tip were a person, it would be consistent, strong, and full of surprises! This is a great tip for achieving long thin petals that can hold their own! BUY NOW 
8

GG Cakraft 106

Uses: Leaves, Eucalyptus, anemones There was never a better tip made for leafing! This tip is thick enough to create substantial single leaves, and thicker petals that can hold their own! I like the GG Cakraft 105 to add sizing variation! BUY NOW 
7

Atecco 00

Uses: Peonies, Love Lies Bleeding, Raspberries, succulents, anemones, billy balls Sometimes it’s in the detail! This tip is great for piping fine details on everything from envies to succulents, and everything in between! BUY NOW 
6

Wilton 4b or 2a

Uses: Making an appearance in literally every 3-dimensional flower you see! Guess where? It’s all about that base! BUY NOW 
5

Wilton 349

Uses: Leafing accents, smaller flowers like lily of the valley and lilacs, sunflowers, dahlias This tip is a work horse! It’s great for fine veining detail, but also exactly what you need for smaller center petals of a flower. BUY NOW 
4

Wilton 101

Uses: Lilacs, lily of the valley, artichokes, peonies, daisies, Gerber daisies, forget-me-nots, apple blossoms, hydrangea This tip is small but might! It’s perfect for adding small details, or piping small flowers to accent your buttercream flower cake or cupcake. BUY NOW 
3

Wilton 123

Uses: Peonies Once upon a time, Wilton 123 was born. He just knew he would grow up to pipe peonies, and one day he did! This tip is the most perfectly made tip for peony flowers in al stages of bloom, which you can learn to pipe at the Academy! BUY NOW 
2

GG Cakraft 1062 or 1061

Uses: Roses, English roses, David Austin roses, Juliette roses, peonies, anemones, leafing This tip is perfect for achieving those delicate larger curved petals on your two-dimensional, and three-dimensional flowers! BUY NOW 
1

Atecco 124k

Uses: Roses, English roses, David Austin roses, Juliette roses, ranunculus flowers, peonies, anemones, carnations, leafing If I were trapped on an island, I would want to have this tip and chapstick! This tip does it all! Purchase at least 10 and you’ll never feel lonely. BUY NOW
